title: TICOVAC Quick Finder
description: HIGHLIGHTS OF PRESCRIBING INFORMATION These highlights do not include all the information needed to use TICOVAC safely and effectively. See full prescribing information for TICOVAC. TICOVAC (Tick-Borne Encephalitis Vaccine), Suspension for intramuscular
cleaned_text: HIGHLIGHTS OF PRESCRIBING INFORMATION These highlights do not include all the information needed to use TICOVAC safely and effectively. See full prescribing information for TICOVAC. TICOVAC (Tick-Borne Encephalitis Vaccine), Suspension for injection Initial U.S. Approval: 2021 INDICATIONS AND USAGE TICOVAC is a vaccine indicated for active immunization to prevent tick-borne encephalitis (TBE). TICOVAC is approved for use in individuals 1 year of age and older. ( DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION For intramuscular use only. Primary Vaccination: Three doses ( A booster dose (fourth dose) may be given at least 3 years after completion of the primary immunization series if ongoing exposure or re-exposure to tick-borne encephalitis virus (TBEV) is expected. DOSAGE FORMS AND STRENGTHS Suspension for injection supplied as a 0.25 mL or 0.5 mL single-dose in pre-filled syringes. ( CONTRAINDICATIONS ADVERSE REACTIONS The most common adverse reactions are as follows: To report SUSPECTED ADVERSE REACTIONS, contact Pfizer Inc. at 1-800-438-1985 or VAERS at 1-800-822-7967 or See 17 for PATIENT COUNSELING INFORMATION. Revised: 7/2023 If you provide additional keywords, you may be able to browse through our database of Scientific Response Documents.
